snippet: The State of California reached a multimillion-dollar agreement today with the Prudential Insurance Company of America, settling allegations that the insurer used deceptive tactics to sell life insurance.     The California Insurance Commissioner,...
lead_paragraph: The State of California reached a multimillion-dollar agreement today with the Prudential Insurance Company of America, settling allegations that the insurer used deceptive tactics to sell life insurance. The California Insurance Commissioner, Charles W. Quackenbush, said Prudential had agreed to pay $15.4 million to life insurance policyholders. The state fined the insurer another $9.5 million in the accord.
abstract: State of California reaches multimillion-dollar agreement with Prudential Insurance Company, settling allegations that insurer used deceptive tactics to sell life insurance (S)

headline.main: California and Prudential Reach Accord in Life Insurance Cases
